name: youtube 3.0 revert to 2.0
description:
this style reverts the pre-December 2012 (NOT current) Youtube style to the old mid-2011 Youtube style
this script is based off the css of mid 2011 youtube (viewed from firebug at: http://web.archive.org/web/20110609204503/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=blvqe-vO8iA&feature=topvideos)
hope you enjoy my 15 hours+ peice of work :D
additional_info:
for this style, you need the pre-December 2012 style. to get that style you need either a cookie:
open a Youtube page,
open your console
Ctrl + Shift + K on Firefox
Ctrl + Shift + J on Chrome
Ctrl + Shift + I on Opera
and paste this javascript:
document.cookie="VISITOR_INFO1_LIVE=qDpUsBNO0FY; expires=Thu, 2 Aug 2020 20:47:11 UTC"

(that might not work, from personal experience, and is more complicated)

or use this userscript (greasemonkey needed):
http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/153968

go on youtube, enable the script, refresh the page, disable the script, refresh the page again, you have pre-december theme, enable this style (you will need to do this each time you close and open the browser...)(enabling te userscript and not disabling it may cause a glitch where multiple instances of the cookie come- if this happens, disable the script, restart browser, enable, go to youtube, disable script, refresh, enable style)
if you use the current theme with this it looks very glitchy


--------------------------------------Versions-----------------------------------

1.0 - 1st public version
1.1 - removed fade effect on items, fixed channel result and title text size, added style of old 'create account' button to 'browse channels button', white text in the black 'active' buttons, added border line at filter, edited HD button to match old one
BUGS: transparent  '[insert #] videos' button text
1.2 - bugs fixed, user button text easier to read, more (old-style) borders added
BUGS: buttons not correct size in name change dialogue for reasons not to change (in that dialogue just disable it, select a reason, then re-enable
